name: Blockbench Settings
summary: Learn about .BBSETTINGS files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Blockbench is a 3D model editor used primarily to create and edit block-based Minecraft models. The program is available as a free download for Windows, macOS, and Linux. It is also available on the web at web.blockbench.net.

Users who want to customize Blockbench's settings can do so using the program's Settings window (opened by selecting File → Preferences... → Settings...). In the Settings window, users can alter Blockbench's General, Interface, Preview, Edit, Grid, Snapping, Paint, Defaults, Dialogs, Application, and Export settings.
Users can export their current Blockbench settings as a BBSETTINGS file by:
Selecting File → Preferences... → Settings... to open the Settings window.
Naming and saving their current settings as a BBSETTINGS file.
For example, a user may want to save their current settings as a BBSETTINGS file so they can import the settings into another instance of Blockbench.

instructions: To apply the settings a BBSETTINGS file contains in Blockbench (cross-platform):
In the Settings window, select Import Settings.
Navigate to and open your BBSETTINGS file.
Blockbench will then apply the settings your BBSETTINGS file contains.
Users who want to view or directly edit the JSON data a BBSETTINGS file contains can open the file in Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (Mac), or any other text or source code editor.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
